Description: Jupiter and Saturn fall into resonance
Formation of the large lunar basins
First simple single-celled life and first microfossils
Stabilisation of the Earth's tectonic plates
Appearance of oxygen in Earth's atmosphere
First ferns trees and seed-bearing plants
First reptiles; Coal forests; Highest ever atmospheric oxygen levels
First dinosaurs and crocodiles; first mammals
Pangea breaks into Gondwana and Laurasia
Widespread forests lower atmospheric CO2 levels
Phobos either crashes into Mars or breaks up into a ring
Big Island of Hawaii will wink beneath the ocean
Earth's continents will form another supercontinent
Moon recedes too far away for total solar eclipses to occur
Increased energy output of Sun causes oceans to boil away
Earth's atmosphere more like Venus' current atmosphere
Andromeda Galaxy and Milky Way merge; 12% chance Sun will be ejected from “Milkomeda”
Sun grows into red giant and may engulf the Earth
